intro: Trichomanes cupressifolium, commonly known as the clubmoss, is a type of primitive vascular plant belonging to the family Huperjiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage that resembles small pine needles, forming compact, cushion-like growths. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its sporophytes are small and inconspicuous, while the gametophytes are more prominent and contribute to its overall appearance. Trichomanes cupressifolium plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
